provider.documentation: Name of the person who has filled this file

mapping_info.provider: R Coelho, M Romanelli, J Ferreira and D Kalupin

description.documentation: Detailed description of this mapping file

mapping_info.description: Correspondance between itm data description and Jet data for JSP

firstputdate.documentation: Date when this file was first submitted to the ITM

lastputdate.documentation: Date when this file was last updated

shot_min.documentation: Minimum shot number in the experiment database for which this mapping file is valid

shot_max.documentation: Maximum shot number in the experiment database for which this mapping file is valid

download_method.documentation: List of the possible download methods (replicate this element if more than one must be used)

name.documentation: Name of the download method (e.g. 'mds+', 'tslib')

download_method.name: mds+

server.documentation: IP address of the experimental data server

port.documentation: Port for communication with the experimental data server

ssh_server.documentation: IP address or name of a remote ssh server for secure access

antennas.documentation: Antenna systems for heating and current drive in the electron cyclotron (EC), ion cylcotron (IC) and lower hybrid (LH) frequencies. Time-dependent CPO.

antenna_ec.documentation: Vector of Electron Cyclotron antennas. Time-dependent

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

current.documentation: Description of the IC surface currents on the antenna straps and on passive components.

spectrum.documentation: Spectrum of the total surface current on the antenna strap and passive components expressed in poloidal and toroidal mode [A]. Calculated using a geometrical poloidal angle around the point rz_reference. Time-dependent; exp1D(n_poloidal_modes , n_toroidal_modes)

Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

rz_reference.documentation: Reference point used to define the poloidal angle, e.g. the geometrical centre of the vacuum vessel. Time-dependent; rz0d

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

nucindex.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

time.documentation: List of the experimental time bases used for this CPO (replicate this element if more than one must be used)

download.documentation: Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name

corefast.documentation: Flux surface averaged fluid measures and transport coefficients of fast particle populations. Here the concept of a fast particle population refer to the difference between the total population and the thermal population. This separation of populations may in practise be achieved differently depending on the physics model. A description of how the separation is achieved should therefore be provided in corefast/values/filter/. Time-dependent CPO.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

imp_flag.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)
imp_flag.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

imp_flag.name: Put value here

Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

coreimpur.documentation: Impurity species (i.e. ion species with multiple charge states), radial core profiles. For heavy impurities, some ionisation states can be grouped into "bundles". Can be the result of an impurity transport code or experimental measurements. Time-dependent CPO

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

compositions.documentation: Contains all the composition information for the simulation (main ions, impurities, neutrals, edge species).

zn.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

zn.name: ion1_charge

amn.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

amn.name: %TDI%ppfuid("%LOCALUSERNAME%"); _aux=jet("PPF/JST/ATM/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%); _nt=SIZE(_aux,0); _a=value_of(_aux)[0]; _b=MOD(_a,3); IF (_b == 0) _amn=[3]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,2) == 0) _amn=[2]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,1) == 0) _amn=[1]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,2) LT 1) _amn=[2,3]; ELSE _amn=[1,2]; public _amn=_amn; public _nion=SIZE(_amn); _sig=MAKE_SIGNAL(SPREAD(_amn[0],0,_nt),*,dim_of(_aux,0))

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

coreprof.documentation: Core plasma 1D profiles as a function of the toroidal flux coordinate, obtained by solving the core transport equations (can be also fitted profiles from experimental data). The codeparam element here describes the parameters of the transport equation solver and/or those of the fitting program. Time-dependent CPO.

amn.name: %TDI%ppfuid("%LOCALUSERNAME%"); _aux=jet("PPF/JST/ATM/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%); _nt=SIZE(_aux,0); _a=value_of(_aux)[0]; _b=MOD(_a,3); IF (_b == 0) _amn=[3]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,2) == 0) _amn=[2]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,1) == 0) _amn=[1]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,2) LT 1) _amn=[2,3]; ELSE _amn=[1,2]; public _amn=_amn; public _nion=SIZE(_amn); _sig=MAKE_SIGNAL(SPREAD(_amn[0],0,_nt),*,dim_of(_aux,0))

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

nucindex.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int
nucindex.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

nucindex.name: %TDI%ppfuid("%LOCALUSERNAME%"); _aux=jet("PPF/JST/ATM/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%); _nt=SIZE(_aux,0); IF (_nion == 1) _sig=MAKE_SIGNAL(SPREAD(1,0,_nt),*,dim_of(_aux,0)); ELSE _sig=jet("PPF/JST/BUBU/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%)

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

boundary.documentation: Boundary condition for the transport equation. Time-dependent.

value.documentation: Value of the boundary condition (in case flag = 2). Unit depends on type, respectively [1-field, 2-field.m^-1, 3-m, 4-field.s^-1]. For type 1 to 4, only the first position in the vector is used. For type 5, all three positions are used, meaning respectively a1, a2, a3. Time-dependent. Vector(3).

type.documentation: Type of the boundary condition for the transport solver (in case flag = 2). 0- equation not solved; 1- value of the field y; 2-radial derivative of the field (-dy/drho_tor); 3-scale length of the field y/(-dy/drho_tor); 4- flux; 5- generic boundary condition y expressed as a1y'+a2y=a3. Time-dependent. Scalar

time_deriv.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

concat_dim.documentation: Dimension of the ITM signal on which to do the concatenation (1 or 2) of the local signals

boundary.documentation: Boundary condition for the transport equation

value.documentation: Value of the boundary condition (in case flag = 2). Unit depends on type, respectively [1-field, 2-field.m^-1, 3-m, 4-field.s^-1]. For type 1 to 4, only the first position in the first dimension is used. For type 5, all three positions are used, meaning respectively a1, a2, a3. Time-dependent. Matrix(3,nion)
value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

type.documentation: Type of the boundary condition for the transport solver (in case flag = 2). 0- equation not solved; 1- value of the field y; 2-radial derivative of the field (-dy/drho_tor); 3-scale length of the field y/(-dy/drho_tor); 4- flux; 5- generic boundary condition y expressed as a1y'+a2y=a3. Time-dependent. Scalar

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: %TDI%ppfuid("%LOCALUSERNAME%"); _ni1=IF_ERROR(jet("PPF/JSP/NI1/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%)); _ni2=IF_ERROR(jet("PPF/JSP/NI2/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%)); _nid=IF_ERROR(jet("PPF/JSP/NID/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%)); _nit=IF_ERROR(jet("PPF/JSP/NIT/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%)); _nitot=IF_ERROR(jet("PPF/JSP/NI/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%)); IF (_nion == 2) IF (SIZE(_ni1,0) == 0) IF (_amn[0] == 1) _sig=BUILD_SIGNAL([jtranspose(_nitot-_nid),jtranspose(_nid)],*,dim_of(_nid,1),dim_of(_nid,0),[1,2]); ELSE _sig=BUILD_SIGNAL([jtranspose(_nid),jtranspose(_nit)],*,dim_of(_nid,1),dim_of(_nid,0),[1,2]); ELSE _sig=BUILD_SIGNAL([jtranspose(_ni1),jtranspose(_ni2)],*,dim_of(_ni1,1),dim_of(_ni1,0),[1,2]); ELSE IF (SIZE(_ni1,0) == 0) _sig=BUILD_SIGNAL([jtranspose(_nitot)],*,dim_of(_nitot,1),dim_of(_nitot,0),[1]); ELSE _sig=BUILD_SIGNAL([jtranspose(_ni1)],*,dim_of(_ni1,1),dim_of(_ni1,0),[1]);

boundary.documentation: Boundary condition for the transport equation

value.documentation: Value of the boundary condition (in case flag = 2). Unit depends on type, respectively [1-field, 2-field.m^-1, 3-m, 4-field.s^-1]. For type 1 to 4, only the first position in the first dimension is used. For type 5, all three positions are used, meaning respectively a1, a2, a3. Time-dependent. Matrix(3,nion)

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

concat_dim.documentation: Dimension of the ITM signal on which to do the concatenation (1 or 2) of the local signals

time_deriv.documentation: Integral of the time derivative term of the transport equation. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

boundary.documentation: Boundary condition for the transport equation

value.documentation: Value of the boundary condition (in case flag = 2). Unit depends on type, respectively [1-field, 2-field.m^-1, 3-m, 4-field.s^-1]. For type 1 to 4, only the first position in the first dimension is used. For type 5, all three positions are used, meaning respectively a1, a2, a3. Time-dependent. Matrix(3,nion)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: PPF/JSP/VOLT

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

w_dia.name: PPF/JST/WTOT

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

geom_axis.documentation: RZ position of the geometric axis (defined as (Rmin+Rmax) / 2 and (Zmin+Zmax) / 2 of the boundary) [m]; Time-dependent; Scalar

amn.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

amn.name: %TDI%ppfuid("%LOCALUSERNAME%"); _aux=jet("PPF/JST/ATM/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%); _nt=SIZE(_aux,0); _a=value_of(_aux)[0]; _b=MOD(_a,3); IF (_b == 0) _amn=[3]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,2) == 0) _amn=[2]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,1) == 0) _amn=[1]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,2) LT 1) _amn=[2,3]; ELSE _amn=[1,2]; public _amn=_amn; public _nion=SIZE(_amn); _sig=MAKE_SIGNAL(SPREAD(_amn[0],0,_nt),*,dim_of(_aux,0))

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

zn.name: ion1_charge

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

amn.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

amn.name: %TDI%ppfuid("%LOCALUSERNAME%"); _aux=jet("PPF/JST/ATM/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%); _nt=SIZE(_aux,0); _a=value_of(_aux)[0]; _b=MOD(_a,3); IF (_b == 0) _amn=[3]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,2) == 0) _amn=[2]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,1) == 0) _amn=[1]; ELSE IF (MOD(_a,2) LT 1) _amn=[2,3]; ELSE _amn=[1,2]; public _amn=_amn; public _nion=SIZE(_amn); _sig=MAKE_SIGNAL(SPREAD(_amn[0],0,_nt),*,dim_of(_aux,0))

zn.name: %TDI%ppfuid("%LOCALUSERNAME%"); _aux=jet("PPF/JST/ATM/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%); _nt=SIZE(_aux,0); IF (_nion == 2) _sig=MAKE_SIGNAL(SPREAD(1,0,_nt),*,dim_of(_aux,0)); ELSE _sig=jet("PPF/JST/BUBU/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%)

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

nucindex.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int
nucindex.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

ne_transp.documentation: Transport coefficients for electron density equation. Time-dependent.

diff_eff.documentation: Effective diffusivity [m^2.s^-1]. The last index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,3)
diff_eff.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

diff_eff.name: %TDI%ppfuid("%LOCALUSERNAME%");_aux=jet("PPF/JSP/XE/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%); _npsi=SIZE(_aux,0); _nti=SIZE(_aux,1); _rad=dim_of(_aux,0); _tmp=jjoin(value_of(_aux),value_of(_aux)[_npsi-1,*]); _bubu=_tmp; _sig = BUILD_SIGNAL(_bubu,*,jjoin([_rad - SPREAD(_rad[0],0, _npsi)],[[1.0]]),dim_of(_aux,1))

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

time.documentation: List of the experimental time bases used for this CPO (replicate this element if more than one must be used)

name.documentation: Name of the time base in the experimental database

time.name: PPF/JSP/RHO

download.documentation: Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name

amn.documentation: Mass of the emmitting impurity. Varies according to channels since they are spanning different lines of sight; Vector (nchannels)
amn.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

amn.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

zn.documentation: Nuclear charge of the emmitting impurity. Varies according to channels since they are spanning different lines of sight; Vector (nchannels)
zn.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

download.documentation: Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name

distribution.documentation: Datastructure for representing data associated with a distribution function one or many particle species. This structure is specifically designed to handle non-Maxwellian distribution function generated during heating and current drive, typically solved using a Fokker-Planck calculation perturbed by a heating scheme (e.g. IC, EC, LH, NBI, or alpha heating) and then relaxed by Coloumb collisions. Time-dependent CPO

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

distri_vec.documentation: Vector over all distribution functions. Every distribution function has to be associated with only one particle species, specifiec in distri_vec/species/, but there could be multiple distribution function for each species. In this case, the fast particle populations should be superposed. Time-dependent. Structure array(ndistri_vec)

global_param.documentation: Global parameters (in most cases volume integrated and surface averaged quanatities). Time-dependent

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

abserror.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector
abserror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

second_point.documentation: Second point defining the line of sight together with the pivot_point. In case the probing wave is reflected, this should be the position of the mirror. This data is redundant with horchordang1 and verchordang1. Vector (nchords).

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

abserror.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

efcc.documentation: Error field correction coils. Time-dependent CPO.

coil.documentation: Individual coil. Time-dependent. Structure array. Replicate this coil structure for coil element in the efcc array.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

a_minor.name: %TDI%ppfuid("%LOCALUSERNAME%"); _RIN=jet("PPF/JSP/RI/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%); _aux=value_of(_RIN); _nrho=size(_aux,0); _ROUT=jet("PPF/JSP/R/%SEQUENCE%",%SHOT%); _aminor=(value_of(_ROUT)[_nrho-1,*]-value_of(_RIN)[_nrho-1,*])/2.0; _sig = MAKE_SIGNAL(_aminor,*,dim_of(_RIN,1));

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

concat_dim.documentation: Dimension of the ITM signal on which to do the concatenation (1 or 2) of the local signals

detect_ct.documentation: Detected integrated emissivity for each chord as function of energy like variable. Replicate this structure for each chord. This structure contains the actual experimental data as obtained from the detector. To get from species emissivity to the detector counts a detector tranfer matrix is used (should be shot independent) since a monoenergetic beam will ultimately show up with a given spread in the detector channels. Each detector type or l.o.s. might have a dedicated detctor transfer matrix since the energy discrimination can vary. [s^-1]. Time-dependent

energy.documentation: Energy array of detected counts spectra. Vector (nenergy)

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

relerror.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Vector
relerror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

relerror.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

concat_dim.documentation: Dimension of the ITM signal on which to do the concatenation (1 or 2) of the local signals

relerror.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Matrix
relerror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

relerror.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

abserror.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector
abserror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

ironmodel.documentation: Model of the iron circuit; Time-dependent CPO

magnetise.documentation: Magnetisation M of the iron segment, assumed to be constant inside a given iron segment. Reminder : H = 1/mu0 * B - mur * M; [A/m].

mr.documentation: Magnetisation along the R axis [T]; Time-dependent; Vector (nsegment)

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

abserror.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector
abserror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

abserror.name: Put value here

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

time.documentation: List of the experimental time bases used for this CPO (replicate this element if more than one must be used)

name.documentation: Name of the time base in the experimental database

time.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

abserror.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector
abserror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

toroid_field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field, redundant with the toroidfield CPO, to document the normalisation of rho and j in this CPO.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

relerror.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Vector
relerror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

relerror.name: Put value here

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

polarimetry.documentation: This structure accomodates the polarimetry setup and measurements of a mse diagnostic, as widely used in fusion devices. The final measurement is the tan(gamma) where gamma is the polarization angle of a particular spectral mse component.

measure.documentation: Measured value (MSE angle gamma [rad]). Time-dependent; Vector (nchords)

spectral.documentation: This structure accommodates the types needed on a spectral MSE diagnostic namely the emmissivity and the radiance spectra. It will be subsequenty upgraded with optical + photon detection elements since the structure will also be used for a synthetic spectral mse code.

radia_chord.documentation: MSE radiance characterization. This structure is used for each line of sight of the MSE setup and contains the geometry of the line of sight, the radiance(wavelength) for each polarization state, the quantization axis. Replicate the structure for each line of sight. Time-dependent

totradiance.documentation: Total Radiance integrated along the lines of sight (Wm^-2sr-^1). Vector (nwavelength)

nbi.documentation: Neutral Beam Injection. Input to NBI source codes; describes the neutrals that are about to be launched into the torus; Time-dependent CPO

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

relerror.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Scalar
relerror.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

time.documentation: List of the experimental time bases used for this CPO (replicate this element if more than one must be used)

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

concat_dim.documentation: Dimension of the ITM signal on which to do the concatenation (1 or 2) of the local signals

mach.documentation: Mach number of each ion species. Time-dependent. Matrix(nrho,nion).

Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

pfsystems.documentation: Description of the active poloidal coils, passive conductors, currents flowing in those and mutual electromagnetic effects of the device; Time-dependent CPO

coilcurrent.documentation: Circuit feed current in the coil, defined positive if it flows from point 1 to point 2 of the component in the pfcircuit description [A]; Time-dependent; Vector (ncoils)

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

abserror.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

time.documentation: List of the experimental time bases used for this CPO (replicate this element if more than one must be used)

name.documentation: Name of the time base in the experimental database

time.name: Put value here

download.documentation: Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name
